result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any Court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount reamining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; and consecutive to any other sentence. 
*1/23/2017  Credit of 37 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol.  No drugs without valid prescription or in manner as prescribed.

Monthly payments to the Trust Fund.
Absolute/maintain sobriety. Random urine screens.
Follow all rules of supervision.  
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one; and consecutive to any other sentence. 
*1/23/2017  credit of 37 days.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 10, calendar successor, for review. spc

Counts one and two.  

(Return address: Antoine Hatchett #478822, Stanley Correctional Institution, 100 Correctional Drive, Stanley, WI   54768).
Per Order signed on 1/23/2017, "JOC shall be amended to reflect 37 days of sentence credit on counts one and two".
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed on January 23, 2017. Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections. File back to closing to amend JOC.
Original Transcript (42 pages) SENTENCING HEARING, commencing DECEMBER 1, 2015,  received and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. spc
Request for sentence credit filed by Atty. Justin Singleton.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 39 MONTHS with 0 (zero) days credit CONCURRENT to count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 39 MONTHS with 0 (zero) days credit CONCURRENT to count 1 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Monthly payments to the Trust Fund.
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs without valid prescription or in manner as prescribed.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
-From defendant's fiance on his behalf; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court, defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: AS.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests sentencing date date.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on November 3, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court ordered bail forfieted.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing. All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Branch 37,  in Room 313 of the Safety Bldg.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
